title: 107_hr4446
content: The "American Dream Downpayment Act" is also known as the Downpayment Assistance Initiative under the HOME Program. It amends the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act to provide downpayment assistance. The Secretary may grant funds to help low-income families achieve homeownership by providing downpayment assistance for the purchase of single-family housing. Participating jurisdictions must include the use of grant amounts in their housing affordability strategy to be eligible for funding. Formula allocation is done annually by the Secretary for assistance under this program. The Secretary establishes a formula to allocate funds for homebuyer assistance based on need and prior commitments of participating jurisdictions. Reallocation of funds to other jurisdictions is done according to the formula, with exceptions for local jurisdictions in participating states. Grants under this section are not subject to certain provisions of the title but are subject to specific requirements and references to funds under subtitle A. Amounts allocated or reallocated under section 217 are considered in the context of this section. The section allows for funds to be used for administrative and planning costs, with limitations based on the total available funds. It also authorizes the Downpayment Assistance Initiative for fiscal year 2002. The Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 2002 authorizes $200,000,000 for fiscal years 2003 through 2006. A new section on relocation and downpayment assistance is added to the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. The Uniform Relocation Assistance and Real Property Acquisition Policies Act of 1970 does not apply to downpayment assistance under this title. The Housing Opportunity Program Extension Act of 1996 is amended to allocate $65,000,000 for fiscal year 2003 and additional funds for fiscal year 2004. The HOPE VI program is reauthorized. SEC. 4. REAUTHORIZATION OF HOPE VI PROGRAM. The authorization of appropriations for the HOPE VI program is amended to allocate $574,000,000 for fiscal year 2003. The sunset date for the program is extended to September 30, 2003.
